title: Legend of Runeterra Bug Reports
body:
So I was playing against someone using Thresh today (he levelled it up). The Thresh card text read the first time it attack this game it summons the strongest minion from deck or hand. So the first time it attacked, pulled a Kalista, as expected, but the second time it attacked, it pulled another Kalista (the first Kalista still on board). I don't think that's the intended effect as described by the card text. 
Also Riot pls add a board for Legend of Runeterra bug reports, thx.

replies.body:
I think i have found a bug on the card "Redoubled valor", the card says double power and health of an ally.
If I'm not mistaken, double should mean :new value=2*current value, but in a match I frostbitten an enemy character, who was then targeted by this spell,so after he comes out of a frostbite his new attack should be his old attack(0)*2=0,but his new attack was equal to his his original  attack which suggests that the new attack is calculated as original attack+current attack, so the card is either bugged  or poorly written, and one of those should be changed

I believe what Redoubled Valor actually does is that it gives the unit +X/+Y, where X and Y are that unit's current stats after the heal resolves. So the Redoubled Valor targeted at the frostbitten unit gave it 0 attack (because its attack was 0 when Redoubled Valor resolved), and therefore when frostbite wore off it had its original attack (since Redoubled Valor had not changed it).

Had what I believe is a bug just now with Lux.

I attacked with a level 1 Lux (no barrier, though I don't think that should have made any difference) and two other units. My opponent blocked one of the other units (but not the Lux), and played Shadow Flare. In response, I played Progress Day!, levelling up my Lux and getting a Final Spark in hand. I then let combat resolve.

The other three units in combat gained ethereal (as they were supposed to) and died, but my Levelled up Lux did not. She survived the turn (and the rest of the game). It would appear that Lux's levelling up due to a burst spell broke the targeting of Shadow Flare, which I don't believe should have happened. (She should have levelled up, given me my Final Spark, and then gained ethereal and died when she struck the enemy nexus.)
I played Rush on my defending Shadow Assassin blocking a Yasuo. My Shadow Assassin died and the Yasuo lived.

That's the correct interaction - quick attack only works when attacking (indicated in-game by the lightning effect lighting up when it is the unit's turn to attack). I had the same confusion previously, due to confusing it with first strike from MTG.
When playing 'Augmented Experimenter', I was able to deal 3 damage to an opponent, however my hand was not discarded and I did not draw new cards.

Ezrael -

I had an Ezrael on board at 6/8 enemy units targeted. Opponent cast Shatter (doubled by Karma) to kill my Ezrael. I cast Statikk Shock in response. When these spells resolved, my Ezrael on the board levelled up (as expected), I drew a card, which was a second Ezrael, and then my Ezrael on the board died (as expected). However, the Ezrael that I had just drawn stayed a level 1 Ezrael, despite showing 8/8 enemy units targeted.

Subsequently I played the second Ezrael (which did not level up), and then cast a couple more spells at my opponent's stuff (Ezrael still did not level up). By the end of the game he showed 10/8 enemy units targeted, but still had not levelled up.

When you give Anivia ephemeral and kill her (without the ephemeral effect) Eggnivia doesn't get the ephemeral keyword. 
Why its a problem?

because there is a card that copies an ally and gives it ephemeral 
(name of the card is splinter soul)

{{champion:34}}

Eggnivia is essentially a new card that is spawned when an Anivia dies, so there is no reason for it to gain the Ephemeral keyword. As far as I know, this is working as intended. 

Given you can only have one Anivia on your board normally, and you would have to both draw and be able to play both of those cards at the same time, it's about as powerful as any other rare combo.
